content: Do a food recall. Eating healthier is a great goal, but a broad one. To help you tailor your goal and figure out exactly what you need to do differently, start by doing a few days of a food recall. A food recall is when you write down detailed notes about what you eat and drink in one day. Include all meals (breakfast, lunch and dinner), any snacks or nibbles throughout the day and anything you drink (or add to your drinks). [1] Be as detailed as possible. If you're not good at remembering what you ate over the last few days, try keeping a food journal for a few days, either on paper or using a smartphone diet-tracking app. After you have your notes, review them and see where you can make changes. This will help you set goals for yourself and design an appropriate meal plan. Examples of things you may want to change include: eating breakfast on a regular basis, drinking less soda, eating more vegetables or snacking less. Write up a meal plan . A meal plan will be a great help to you when you're attempting to make changes to your eating pattern and style. This will be a guide or blueprint for all your food choices. [2] A meal plan can be very detailed or just a few notes, but take some time and write out your ideas of what you are going to eat for breakfast, lunch, dinner, snacks and beverages for the coming week. Having a week or two of meals laid out in front of you can help you visually see if you're making the right changes to your diet. You can look and see if you're meeting your goals, like including a vegetable at each meal or scheduling a balanced breakfast every morning. Use your meal plan to guide you throughout the week. You can also use it to help you write up a grocery list to make sure you purchase everything you need at the store. Eat a balanced and varied diet. One of the main components to "eating healthy" is having a balanced and varied diet. [3] Without these, it's difficult to make sure you're eating a nutritious diet. A balanced diet means that you're eating the right amounts of the right types of foods for you. [4] For example, you don't want to eat mostly grains and forget about fruits and vegetables. Also, make sure that you have a varied diet as well. That means eating a wide variety of foods from within each food group. For example, don't only go for an apple every day. Rotate through apples, oranges, berries or pineapple. A combination of both a balanced and varied diet will provide the basis for a nutritious diet that provides with you with all the recommended vitamins and minerals you need. Make half of your plate a fruit or vegetable. One of the ways to make your meal balanced and nutritious is by filling up half your plate with a fruit or a vegetable. Both fruits and vegetables are low-calorie and high in fiber, vitamins, minerals and antioxidants. [5] [6] These foods are main sources of many essential nutrients. Include one to two servings of either fruit or vegetables at each meal and snack. One serving of fruit is 1/2 cup or one small piece, [7] and one serving of vegetables is 1 cup of chopped veggies (like carrots or broccoli) or 1 to 2 cups of leafy greens like kale. [8] If you can, try to choose the fruits and vegetables that are the most nutrient-dense. These foods are incredibly high in nutrients compared to others and are typically darker and brighter in color. For example, dark green vegetables like spinach or kale are much higher in vitamins (especially Vitamin A and K) when compared to iceberg lettuce, which is almost white. Choose lean protein. Lean protein is another essential component to your diet. Protein provides the building blocks your body needs to function every day. [9] To meet your daily recommended needs, include a 3 – 4 oz serving of protein at each meal. One serving is about the size of your palm or a deck of cards. [10] Leaner proteins are lower in calories and fat compared to proteins that are less lean and make an important part of a healthy diet. [11] Choose foods like: poultry, eggs, lean pork, lean beef, seafood, tofu and legumes. Limit fattier protein sources like sausage, bacon, deep-fried fish/chicken, processed meats and higher-fat beef and pork. Go for whole grains. Grain-based foods make up a large part of many diets. Foods like breads, rices and pastas are delicious and can be a part of a healthy diet. Make most, if not all, of your grain choices 100% whole grain. Whole grains are minimally processed and contain each part of the grain (the bran, endosperm and germ). This makes whole grains higher in fiber, protein and other nutrients that are beneficial to your diet. [12] More refined grains like white bread or white rice are stripped of those vital nutrients. These types of foods should be limited in your diet. Stick to 1/2 cup or 1 oz servings of whole grains. [13] Try foods like: 100% whole grain breads and pastas, brown rice, quinoa, oats, millet and barley. Drink adequate fluids. Outside of foods, drinking adequate fluids can also help you have a healthier diet. Although water doesn't provide any nutrients, it's an essential part of your diet. Water is important for a variety of functions in your body including regulating body temperature, maintaining acid/base balance, lubricating joints and managing your blood pressure. [14] Most health professionals recommend consuming anywhere from eight to 13 8-ounce glasses of water daily (1.9 to 3 liters). This will differ for everyone based on gender, age and activity level. You should drink enough so that you do not feel thirsty at any point during the day. [15] Stick to clear, sugar-free and decaffeinated beverages. Try: water, flavored water, unsweetened decaf coffee and tea. Limit sugary drinks and alcohol. These contain excess calories and provide little to no worthwhile nutrition. [16] Keep alcohol at a max of one serving or less daily for women and two servings or less for men. [17] Snack smart. Snacking can get a bad rap in terms of "healthy eating." Many people associate snacking with foods like chips or candies; however, eating a healthy snack can help improve your overall diet. Snacks are a great addition to your diet when you're feeling hungry and your next meal isn't for another few hours, to help you fuel up for a workout, or recover from an intense exercise session. [18] Snacks can lead to unhealthy weight gain if you eat when you're not hungry or out of boredom, or if you choose unhealthier foods. [19] Snacks, like your meals, should be well-balanced and contain a combination of lean protein, fruit, or vegetables. Limit processed foods, foods with added sugars or those that are higher in fat and calories. Desserts, candies, cookies, pastries or chips should be limited. You do not have to avoid these foods completely, but these treats should only be eaten in moderation. Examples of nutritious snacks include: 1/2 cup of yogurt with 1/2 cup of fruit; four whole grain crackers with 1 oz of low-fat cheese; a handful of nuts (raw walnuts, almonds, macadamia nuts); or an apple with a low-fat cheese stick. Make healthier versions of your favorites. Many times people perceive healthy eating as "boring and flavorless." Actually, the opposite is true, especially if you take the time to make foods you truly enjoy. Don't misconceive healthy eating as only salads, plain steamed vegetables or baked lean proteins without any flavors. Spending some time researching different ways to make healthy foods enjoyable will be to your benefit. If you're not truly enjoying the foods you're eating, you most likely won't continue with your healthy eating pattern long-term. Start by reviewing the recipes of some of your favorite foods or meals. You can always add in extra veggies to baked dishes like baked pastas, meatballs, meatloaf and even cakes. Use 100% whole grain flour when baking and swap the sugar for applesauce. For example, if you love mac and cheese, add some pureed butternut squash to the sauce and toss in some of your favorite vegetables with the noodles. You could also try making homemade baked sweet potato fries instead of regular french fries. Add shredded carrots or zucchini to cakes, cookies and muffins for an extra hit of nutrition. Plan out what exercise you're going to do. Like your meal plan for healthy eating, spend some time thinking about what types of exercise you'd like to include for your activity. There are many different ways to be active. The more you enjoy your workouts, the more likely you are to stick with them long-term. Consider what types of activity you may want to include. It is important to include both cardio and strength training activity each week for the best overall exercise and health benefits. [20] Gyms are a great place to join if you want to work on adding in physical activity. You have access to group classes, cardio machines, weight machines and personal training staff. If you're not one for the gym, consider what activities you can do at home. You may want to purchase exercise DVDs, plan a walking/running route or find free online videos. Find activities you want to do each week and schedule them into your day and week. [21] Include regular, moderate-intensity physical activity every week. One main type of exercise is aerobic exercise (cardio). These activities have a lot of great health benefits when done on a regular and weekly basis. The USDA recommends doing about 150 minutes or 2 1/2 hours of moderate-intensity cardio activity each week. Moderate intensity activities are those that make you sweat and get your heart rate elevated for at least 10 – 20 minutes. [22] The benefits associated with cardio exercises include: weight loss or healthy weight support, decreased risk of diabetes and high blood pressure, decreased risk for obesity, improved mood and sleep habits. [23] Do a combination of activities that you've planned out. They can be anything from swimming, dancing, hiking, walking or doing a gym aerobics class. Add in resistance and strength training. In addition to cardio, you should do strength training each week. These exercises offer different health benefits than cardio and will help round out your physical activity regimen. Strength or resistance training exercises aim to help build your lean muscle mass. The benefits include more dense and hard bones, decreased risk of osteoporosis, increases in lean muscle mass and increased metabolism. [24] Activities like weight lifting, yoga or pilates can all count as strength training. Choose your favorite activity and include it two to three days a week in addition to your cardio. [25] Increase your baseline activity. The last main type of activity is baseline or lifestyle activity. Although it's not considered planned or consistent exercise, there are still a variety of benefits to increasing your baseline activity. Lifestyle activities are those that you already perform as part of your daily life. These can include walking to and from your car, doing laundry, raking leaves and taking the stairs. These types of activities do not count towards your 150 minutes of planned cardio each week. These are done in addition to that. Studies have shown that these activities may provide similar benefits to more traditional, planned physical activity (like going for a 30 minute jog). They can also increase or support these benefits if done in combination with planned physical activity. Visit your doctor regularly. In addition to eating healthy and being physically active, visiting your doctor on a regular basis can help support your goals to be healthier. Speak to your doctor regarding your new plan for a healthier diet and physical activity routine. They will be able to tell you whether or not your plan is safe and appropriate for you. Talk to your doctor about why you want to eat healthier and exercise more often. They may have some tips for you and may be able to let you know long-term whether or not your plan has had a positive effect on your health. Your doctor may also be able to refer you to a registered dietitian or personal trainer to help you get additional guidance on your goals. Try new things. When you're first starting with a new type of diet and exercise plan, it can be exciting and fun. Over time you might get bored with your routine which may make it more likely that you'll give up. [26] Trying new things to keep your routines fresh can help you stay motivated and interested in your plan for a healthier lifestyle. [27] A few ways to keep your healthy eating plan fun and fresh are by: trying new recipes, buy a new ingredient or new item you've never tried, or try recreating your favorite restaurant or comfort foods at home. You may also get bored with your fitness routine. Like your diet, there are some ways to keep things fresh like: signing up for a race or competition, find an exercise buddy, signing up for a new gym class or listening to a good audiobook while you work out. Start a journal. Starting a journal is a great way to help you stay on track with your new diet pattern and fitness routine. Try journaling about your old eating habits, what you want to change and how it's going with your new eating habits. A food journal can provide you with a lot of insight on why you eat, when you eat and how certain foods affect your body. [28] You can also use your journal to write out your meal plan and fitness plans for the week. It may also be a good place to track your progress towards your goals. You can make notes about how easy or hard it's been and how your goals have changed over time. Take regular measurements. Regardless of what your ultimate end goal is, taking some measurements may help keep you on track with your healthy eating and activity plan long-term. [29] When you eat healthier and are more active you may lose some weight. Regular weigh-ins can help you see how your new goals have affected your weight. Weight yourself once a week — you're more likely to stick with your plan if you weigh yourself regularly. Make sure you do it at the same time of day each week, wearing the same clothing. [30] You may also want to consider tracking your clothes size, waist or hip size as well. If you notice any of your measurements getting too big or too small, you can return to your journal and make any changes you need to your eating and fitness plans.

<div class="section sticky hasad" id="intro">
<h1 class="firstHeading no_toc"><a href="https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise">How to Eat Healthy and Exercise</a></h1>
<div class="ss_check" id="expert_coauthor">
	
	Co-authored by <a class="expert_icon expert_coauthor_link" href="#article_info_section">
		Michele Dolan</a>
</div>
<p class="vertical_toc" id="method_toc">
<span class="header_toc">Explore this Article</span>
<a class="toc_method" href="#Improving_Your_Diet_sub" id="">Improving Your Diet</a>
<a class="toc_method" href="#Incorporating_Physical_Activity_sub" id="">Incorporating Physical Activity</a>
<a class="toc_method" href="#Maintaining_a_Healthy_Lifestyle_sub" id="">Maintaining a Healthy Lifestyle</a>
<a class="" href="#Questions_and_Answers_sub" id="qa_toc">Expert Q&A</a>
<a class="" href="#relatedwikihows" id="rwh_toc">Related Articles</a>
<a class="toc_ref" href="#references" id="">References</a>
</p>
<div hidden="" id="sp_icon_hover">
<div id="sp_icon_body">
		This article was co-authored by <a href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=micheledolan#micheledolan">Michele Dolan</a>. Michele Dolan is a BCRPA certified Personal Trainer in British Columbia. She has been a personal trainer and fitness instructor since 2002.<br/><br/>There are <a href="#references">30 references</a> cited in this article, which can be found at the bottom of the page.
		
	</div>
</div>
<p>Eating healthy and exercising can seem like a pretty simple and straightforward goal; however, there are many different components to a healthy diet and fitness program. For example, you'll need to think about when and where you'll be working out, what foods to eat, how much to eat, and how to prepare them. Starting with a <a href="/Set-SMART-Goals" title="Set SMART Goals">specific goal</a> and detailed plan can help you implement the changes you need to help you eat healthier and be more active.</p>

<h2 class="hidden"><span class="mw-headline" id="Steps">Steps</span></h2>
<a class="anchor" name="Improving_Your_Diet_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky steps_first">
<h3>
<div class="altblock">Part <span>1</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Improving_Your_Diet">Improving Your Diet</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_1">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-1-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=479768" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-1-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3a/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-1-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_30c353d61f" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_30c353d61f')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3a/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-1-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript>
<script>WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');</script></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Do a food recall.</b> Eating healthier is a great goal, but a broad one. To help you tailor your goal and figure out exactly what you need to do differently, start by doing a few days of a food recall.

<ul>
<li>A food recall is when you write down detailed notes about what you eat and drink in one day. Include all meals (breakfast, lunch and dinner), any snacks or nibbles throughout the day and anything you drink (or add to your drinks).<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 1" class="reference" id="_ref-1"><a href="#_note-1">[1]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Be as detailed as possible. If you're not good at remembering what you ate over the last few days, try keeping a <a href="/Keep-a-Food-Diary" title="Keep a Food Diary">food journal</a> for a few days, either on paper or using a smartphone diet-tracking app.</li>
<li>After you have your notes, review them and see where you can make changes. This will help you set goals for yourself and design an appropriate meal plan.</li>
<li>Examples of things you may want to change include: eating breakfast on a regular basis, drinking less soda, eating more vegetables or snacking less.</li>
</ul>
<script>WH.performance.mark('step1_rendered');</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-2-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=479768" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-2-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/72/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-2-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_efceadc908" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_efceadc908')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/72/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-2-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb"><a href="/Meal-Plan" title="Meal Plan">Write up a meal plan</a>.</b> A meal plan will be a great help to you when you're attempting to make changes to your eating pattern and style. This will be a guide or blueprint for all your food choices.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 2" class="reference" id="_ref-2"><a href="#_note-2">[2]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>A meal plan can be very detailed or just a few notes, but take some time and write out your ideas of what you are going to eat for breakfast, lunch, dinner, snacks and beverages for the coming week.</li>
<li>Having a week or two of meals laid out in front of you can help you visually see if you're making the right changes to your diet. You can look and see if you're meeting your goals, like including a vegetable at each meal or scheduling a balanced breakfast every morning.</li>
<li>Use your meal plan to guide you throughout the week. You can also use it to help you write up a grocery list to make sure you purchase everything you need at the store.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-3-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=479768" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-3-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3d/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-3-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_fb654a8af2" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_fb654a8af2')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3d/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-3-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Eat a balanced and varied diet.</b> One of the main components to "eating healthy" is having a balanced and varied diet.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 3" class="reference" id="_ref-3"><a href="#_note-3">[3]</a></sup> Without these, it's difficult to make sure you're eating a nutritious diet.

<ul>
<li>A balanced diet means that you're eating the right amounts of the right types of foods for you.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 4" class="reference" id="_ref-4"><a href="#_note-4">[4]</a></sup> For example, you don't want to eat mostly grains and forget about fruits and vegetables.</li>
<li>Also, make sure that you have a varied diet as well. That means eating a wide variety of foods from within each food group. For example, don't only go for an apple every day. Rotate through apples, oranges, berries or pineapple.</li>
<li>A combination of both a balanced and varied diet will provide the basis for a nutritious diet that provides with you with all the recommended vitamins and minerals you need.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-4-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=479768" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-4-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e6/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-4-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_381b5179cf" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_381b5179cf')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e6/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-4-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Make half of your plate a fruit or vegetable.</b> One of the ways to make your meal balanced and nutritious is by filling up half your plate with a fruit or a vegetable.

<ul>
<li>Both fruits and vegetables are low-calorie and high in fiber, vitamins, minerals and antioxidants.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 5" class="reference" id="_ref-5"><a href="#_note-5">[5]</a></sup><sup aria-label="Link to Reference 6" class="reference" id="_ref-6"><a href="#_note-6">[6]</a></sup> These foods are main sources of many essential nutrients.</li>
<li>Include one to two servings of either fruit or vegetables at each meal and snack. One serving of fruit is 1/2 cup or one small piece,<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 7" class="reference" id="_ref-7"><a href="#_note-7">[7]</a></sup> and one serving of vegetables is 1 cup of chopped veggies (like carrots or broccoli) or 1 to 2 cups of leafy greens like kale.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 8" class="reference" id="_ref-8"><a href="#_note-8">[8]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>If you can, try to choose the fruits and vegetables that are the most nutrient-dense. These foods are incredibly high in nutrients compared to others and are typically darker and brighter in color. For example, dark green vegetables like spinach or kale are much higher in vitamins (especially Vitamin A and K) when compared to iceberg lettuce, which is almost white.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-5-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=479768" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-5-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bc/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-5-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_75bb3bfa0e" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_75bb3bfa0e')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bc/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-5-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Choose lean protein.</b> Lean protein is another essential component to your diet. Protein provides the building blocks your body needs to function every day.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 9" class="reference" id="_ref-9"><a href="#_note-9">[9]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>To meet your daily recommended needs, include a 3 – 4 oz serving of protein at each meal. One serving is about the size of your palm or a deck of cards.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 10" class="reference" id="_ref-10"><a href="#_note-10">[10]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Leaner proteins are lower in calories and fat compared to proteins that are less lean and make an important part of a healthy diet.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 11" class="reference" id="_ref-11"><a href="#_note-11">[11]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Choose foods like: poultry, eggs, lean pork, lean beef, seafood, tofu and legumes. Limit fattier protein sources like sausage, bacon, deep-fried fish/chicken, processed meats and higher-fat beef and pork.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-6-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=479768" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-6-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cd/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-6-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_dd75d10566" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_dd75d10566')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cd/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-6-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Go for whole grains.</b> Grain-based foods make up a large part of many diets. Foods like breads, rices and pastas are delicious and can be a part of a healthy diet. Make most, if not all, of your grain choices 100% whole grain.

<ul>
<li>Whole grains are minimally processed and contain each part of the grain (the bran, endosperm and germ). This makes whole grains higher in fiber, protein and other nutrients that are beneficial to your diet.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 12" class="reference" id="_ref-12"><a href="#_note-12">[12]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>More refined grains like white bread or white rice are stripped of those vital nutrients. These types of foods should be limited in your diet.</li>
<li>Stick to 1/2 cup or 1 oz servings of whole grains.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 13" class="reference" id="_ref-13"><a href="#_note-13">[13]</a></sup> Try foods like: 100% whole grain breads and pastas, brown rice, quinoa, oats, millet and barley.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-7-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=479768" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-7-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/81/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-7-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_97799b2813" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_97799b2813')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/81/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-7-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 7" class="step_num">7</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_7"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Drink adequate fluids.</b> Outside of foods, drinking adequate fluids can also help you have a healthier diet. Although water doesn't provide any nutrients, it's an essential part of your diet.

<ul>
<li>Water is important for a variety of functions in your body including regulating body temperature, maintaining acid/base balance, lubricating joints and managing your blood pressure.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 14" class="reference" id="_ref-14"><a href="#_note-14">[14]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Most health professionals recommend consuming anywhere from eight to 13 8-ounce glasses of water daily (1.9 to 3 liters). This will differ for everyone based on gender, age and activity level. You should drink enough so that you do not feel thirsty at any point during the day.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 15" class="reference" id="_ref-15"><a href="#_note-15">[15]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Stick to clear, sugar-free and decaffeinated beverages. Try: water, flavored water, unsweetened decaf coffee and tea.</li>
<li>Limit sugary drinks and alcohol. These contain excess calories and provide little to no worthwhile nutrition.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 16" class="reference" id="_ref-16"><a href="#_note-16">[16]</a></sup> Keep alcohol at a max of one serving or less daily for women and two servings or less for men.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 17" class="reference" id="_ref-17"><a href="#_note-17">[17]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-8-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=479768" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-8-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c2/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-8-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_d39baca313" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_d39baca313')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c2/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-8-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 8" class="step_num">8</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_8"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Snack smart.</b> Snacking can get a bad rap in terms of "healthy eating." Many people associate snacking with foods like chips or candies; however, eating a <i>healthy</i> snack can help improve your overall diet.

<ul>
<li>Snacks are a great addition to your diet when you're feeling hungry and your next meal isn't for another few hours, to help you fuel up for a workout, or recover from an intense exercise session.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 18" class="reference" id="_ref-18"><a href="#_note-18">[18]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Snacks can lead to unhealthy weight gain if you eat when you're not hungry or out of boredom, or if you choose unhealthier foods.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 19" class="reference" id="_ref-19"><a href="#_note-19">[19]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Snacks, like your meals, should be well-balanced and contain a combination of lean protein, fruit, or vegetables.</li>
<li>Limit processed foods, foods with added sugars or those that are higher in fat and calories. Desserts, candies, cookies, pastries or chips should be limited. You do not have to avoid these foods completely, but these treats should only be eaten in moderation.</li>
<li>Examples of nutritious snacks include: 1/2 cup of yogurt with 1/2 cup of fruit; four whole grain crackers with 1 oz of low-fat cheese; a handful of nuts (raw walnuts, almonds, macadamia nuts); or an apple with a low-fat cheese stick.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-9-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=479768" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-9-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f4/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-9-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_37b0911d4c" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_37b0911d4c')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f4/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-9-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 9" class="step_num">9</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_9"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Make healthier versions of your favorites.</b> Many times people perceive healthy eating as "boring and flavorless." Actually, the opposite is true, especially if you take the time to make foods you truly enjoy.

<ul>
<li>Don't misconceive healthy eating as only salads, plain steamed vegetables or baked lean proteins without any flavors. Spending some time researching different ways to make healthy foods enjoyable will be to your benefit.</li>
<li>If you're not truly enjoying the foods you're eating, you most likely won't continue with your healthy eating pattern long-term.</li>
<li>Start by reviewing the recipes of some of your favorite foods or meals. You can always add in extra veggies to baked dishes like baked pastas, meatballs, meatloaf and even cakes. Use 100% whole grain flour when baking and swap the sugar for applesauce.</li>
<li>For example, if you love mac and cheese, add some pureed butternut squash to the sauce and toss in some of your favorite vegetables with the noodles. You could also try making homemade baked sweet potato fries instead of regular french fries. Add shredded carrots or zucchini to cakes, cookies and muffins for an extra hit of nutrition.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="methodad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-apsload="1" data-channels="6381149051,3492389196" data-lateload="0" data-loaded="0" data-service="dfp" data-slot="" data-viewablerefresh="1">
<div id="methodad"></div>
<script>googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('methodad'); });</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addBodyAd('methodad')</script>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Incorporating_Physical_Activity_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock">Part <span>2</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Incorporating_Physical_Activity">Incorporating Physical Activity</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_2">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-10-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=479768" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-10-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/de/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-10-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_46aaf97ae5" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_46aaf97ae5')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/de/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-10-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Plan out what exercise you're going to do.</b> Like your meal plan for healthy eating, spend some time thinking about what types of exercise you'd like to include for your activity.

<ul>
<li>There are many different ways to be active. The more you enjoy your workouts, the more likely you are to stick with them long-term.</li>
<li>Consider what types of activity you may want to include. It is important to include both cardio and strength training activity each week for the best overall exercise and health benefits.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 20" class="reference" id="_ref-20"><a href="#_note-20">[20]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Gyms are a great place to join if you want to work on adding in physical activity. You have access to group classes, cardio machines, weight machines and personal training staff.</li>
<li>If you're not one for the gym, consider what activities you can do at home. You may want to purchase exercise DVDs, plan a walking/running route or find free online videos.</li>
<li>Find activities you want to do each week and schedule them into your day and week.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 21" class="reference" id="_ref-21"><a href="#_note-21">[21]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-11-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=479768" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-11-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5d/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-11-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_2d9f7fb61f" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_2d9f7fb61f')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5d/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-11-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Include regular, moderate-intensity physical activity every week.</b> One main type of exercise is aerobic exercise (cardio). These activities have a lot of great health benefits when done on a regular and weekly basis.

<ul>
<li>The USDA recommends doing about 150 minutes or 2 1/2 hours of moderate-intensity cardio activity each week. Moderate intensity activities are those that make you sweat and get your heart rate elevated for at least 10 – 20 minutes.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 22" class="reference" id="_ref-22"><a href="#_note-22">[22]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>The benefits associated with cardio exercises include: weight loss or healthy weight support, decreased risk of diabetes and high blood pressure, decreased risk for obesity, improved mood and sleep habits.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 23" class="reference" id="_ref-23"><a href="#_note-23">[23]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Do a combination of activities that you've planned out. They can be anything from swimming, dancing, hiking, walking or doing a gym aerobics class.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-12-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=479768" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-12-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/de/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-12-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_9c2f571799" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_9c2f571799')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/de/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-12-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Add in resistance and strength training.</b> In addition to cardio, you should do strength training each week. These exercises offer different health benefits than cardio and will help round out your physical activity regimen.

<ul>
<li>Strength or resistance training exercises aim to help build your lean muscle mass. The benefits include more dense and hard bones, decreased risk of osteoporosis, increases in lean muscle mass and increased metabolism.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 24" class="reference" id="_ref-24"><a href="#_note-24">[24]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Activities like weight lifting, yoga or pilates can all count as strength training. Choose your favorite activity and include it two to three days a week in addition to your cardio.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 25" class="reference" id="_ref-25"><a href="#_note-25">[25]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-13-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=479768" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-13-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8b/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-13-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_ab44a85c2f" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_ab44a85c2f')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8b/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-13-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Increase your baseline activity.</b> The last main type of activity is baseline or lifestyle activity. Although it's not considered planned or consistent exercise, there are still a variety of benefits to increasing your baseline activity.

<ul>
<li>Lifestyle activities are those that you already perform as part of your daily life. These can include walking to and from your car, doing laundry, raking leaves and taking the stairs.</li>
<li>These types of activities do not count towards your 150 minutes of planned cardio each week. These are done in addition to that.</li>
<li>Studies have shown that these activities may provide similar benefits to more traditional, planned physical activity (like going for a 30 minute jog). They can also increase or support these benefits if done in combination with planned physical activity.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div id="tocad_wrap">
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="tocad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-channels="6381149051,3492389196" data-lateload="1" data-loaded="0" data-service="adsense" data-slot="3356467874" data-viewablerefresh="1" id="tocad_outer"><div class="step_ad" id="tocad"></div></div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addTOCAd('tocad')</script>
</div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Maintaining_a_Healthy_Lifestyle_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock">Part <span>3</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Maintaining_a_Healthy_Lifestyle">Maintaining a Healthy Lifestyle</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_3">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-14-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=479768" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-14-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-14-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_a81fe91a2d" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_a81fe91a2d')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-14-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Visit your doctor regularly.</b> In addition to eating healthy and being physically active, visiting your doctor on a regular basis can help support your goals to be healthier.

<ul>
<li>Speak to your doctor regarding your new plan for a healthier diet and physical activity routine. They will be able to tell you whether or not your plan is safe and appropriate for you.</li>
<li>Talk to your doctor about why you want to eat healthier and exercise more often. They may have some tips for you and may be able to let you know long-term whether or not your plan has had a positive effect on your health.</li>
<li>Your doctor may also be able to refer you to a registered dietitian or personal trainer to help you get additional guidance on your goals.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-15-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=479768" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-15-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 15" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/42/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-15-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-15-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_d9344a7542" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_d9344a7542')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 15" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/42/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-15-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-15-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Try new things.</b> When you're first starting with a new type of diet and exercise plan, it can be exciting and fun. Over time you might get bored with your routine which may make it more likely that you'll give up.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 26" class="reference" id="_ref-26"><a href="#_note-26">[26]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Trying new things to keep your routines fresh can help you stay motivated and interested in your plan for a healthier lifestyle.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 27" class="reference" id="_ref-27"><a href="#_note-27">[27]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>A few ways to keep your healthy eating plan fun and fresh are by: trying new recipes, buy a new ingredient or new item you've never tried, or try recreating your favorite restaurant or comfort foods at home.</li>
<li>You may also get bored with your fitness routine. Like your diet, there are some ways to keep things fresh like: signing up for a race or competition, find an exercise buddy, signing up for a new gym class or listening to a good audiobook while you work out.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-16-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=479768" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-16-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 16" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/60/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-16-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-16-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_0c36890403" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_0c36890403')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 16" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/60/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-16-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-16-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Start a journal.</b> Starting a journal is a great way to help you stay on track with your new diet pattern and fitness routine.

<ul>
<li>Try journaling about your old eating habits, what you want to change and how it's going with your new eating habits. A food journal can provide you with a lot of insight on why you eat, when you eat and how certain foods affect your body.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 28" class="reference" id="_ref-28"><a href="#_note-28">[28]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>You can also use your journal to write out your meal plan and fitness plans for the week.</li>
<li>It may also be a good place to track your progress towards your goals. You can make notes about how easy or hard it's been and how your goals have changed over time.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage final_li">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-17-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=479768" href="#/Image:Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-17-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 17" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-17-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-17-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_a53e2770c8" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_a53e2770c8')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Eat Healthy and Exercise Step 17" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-17-Version-2.jpg/aid479768-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-17-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Take regular measurements.</b> Regardless of what your ultimate end goal is, taking some measurements may help keep you on track with your healthy eating and activity plan long-term.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 29" class="reference" id="_ref-29"><a href="#_note-29">[29]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>When you eat healthier and are more active you may lose some weight. Regular weigh-ins can help you see how your new goals have affected your weight. Weight yourself once a week — you're more likely to stick with your plan if you weigh yourself regularly. Make sure you do it at the same time of day each week, wearing the same clothing.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 30" class="reference" id="_ref-30"><a href="#_note-30">[30]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>You may also want to consider tracking your clothes size, waist or hip size as well. If you notice any of your measurements getting too big or too small, you can return to your journal and make any changes you need to your eating and fitness plans.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="127968" data-caid="128841" data-cqid="127985" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="443127" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="5476" data-votes_down="3" data-votes_up="22">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">How long should I wait to go to sleep after eating?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_expert_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box">
<a class="sp_namelink qa_person_circle" href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=micheledolan#micheledolan" target="_blank">
<span>MD</span></a>
<div class="qa_expert_name">
<a class="sp_namelink" href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=micheledolan#micheledolan" target="_blank">Michele Dolan</a><br/>
	Certified Personal Trainer
</div>
Michele Dolan is a BCRPA certified Personal Trainer in British Columbia. She has been a personal trainer and fitness instructor since 2002.
</div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<a class="sp_namelink qa_person_circle" href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=micheledolan#micheledolan" target="_blank">
<span>MD</span></a>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name">
<a href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=micheledolan#micheledolan" target="_blank">Michele Dolan</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_user_title">Certified Personal Trainer</div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Expert Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">It is generally recommended to finish eating at least one to two hours before bed. Your body needs some time to begin the digestion process before lying down. Those who eat immediately before lying down for bed often experience digestive troubles such as heartburn and acid reflux.
</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">

</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="494934" data-caid="495807" data-cqid="494951" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="5476" data-votes_down="1" data-votes_up="3">

<div class="qa_q_txt question">What is the healthiest way to lose weight?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_expert_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box">
<a class="sp_namelink qa_person_circle" href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=micheledolan#micheledolan" target="_blank">
<span>MD</span></a>
<div class="qa_expert_name">

Michele Dolan is a BCRPA certified Personal Trainer in British Columbia. She has been a personal trainer and fitness instructor since 2002.
</div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<a class="sp_namelink qa_person_circle" href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=micheledolan#micheledolan" target="_blank">
<span>MD</span></a>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name">
<a href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=micheledolan#micheledolan" target="_blank">Michele Dolan</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_user_title">Certified Personal Trainer</div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Expert Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Reducing calorie intake and eating a well balanced diet combined with regular (daily) exercise is the healthiest way to lose weight.</div>

<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="494938" data-caid="495811" data-cqid="494955" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="5476" data-votes_down="2" data-votes_up="3">

Michele Dolan is a BCRPA certified Personal Trainer in British Columbia. She has been a personal trainer and fitness instructor since 2002.
</div>

<span>MD</span></a>

<div class="qa_answer answer">A healthy balanced diet composed primarily of whole natural foods like vegetables, fruit, whole grains, meat, fish, dairy, etc., is recommended.</div>

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="494927" data-caid="495800" data-cqid="494944" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="5476" data-votes_down="2" data-votes_up="3">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Is it OK to exercise after eating?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_expert_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box">
<a class="sp_namelink qa_person_circle" href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=micheledolan#micheledolan" target="_blank">
<span>MD</span></a>
<div class="qa_expert_name">

Michele Dolan is a BCRPA certified Personal Trainer in British Columbia. She has been a personal trainer and fitness instructor since 2002.

<div class="qa_badge"></div>

<span>MD</span></a>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">

<a href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=micheledolan#micheledolan" target="_blank">Michele Dolan</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_user_title">Certified Personal Trainer</div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Expert Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Yes, it's fine to exercise after eating as long as you feel fine and don't experience indigestion.</div>

<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="494930" data-caid="495803" data-cqid="494947" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="5476" data-votes_down="4" data-votes_up="1">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Are you supposed to exercise before or after you eat?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_expert_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box">
<a class="sp_namelink qa_person_circle" href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=micheledolan#micheledolan" target="_blank">
<span>MD</span></a>
<div class="qa_expert_name">
<a class="sp_namelink" href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=micheledolan#micheledolan" target="_blank">Michele Dolan</a><br/>
	Certified Personal Trainer
</div>
Michele Dolan is a BCRPA certified Personal Trainer in British Columbia. She has been a personal trainer and fitness instructor since 2002.
</div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<a class="sp_namelink qa_person_circle" href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=micheledolan#micheledolan" target="_blank">
<span>MD</span></a>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name">
<a href="/Special:ArticleReviewers?name=micheledolan#micheledolan" target="_blank">Michele Dolan</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_user_title">Certified Personal Trainer</div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Expert Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">There is no hard rule about this. Do what works best for you. If you are trying to build muscle, you might have a protein rich snack after your workout, and if your workouts are very long — over an hour — you might want a carb rich snack before or after your workout.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="267239" data-caid="268112" data-cqid="267256" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="1367702" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="2" data-votes_up="4">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">What if I'm allergic to Gluten?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">You can still eat healthily. Most of the suggested foods in the article have no gluten, and you can always check the ingredients when purchasing food. </div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>

</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="456510" data-caid="457383" data-cqid="456527" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="1781906" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="3" data-votes_up="2">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">How can I eat healthier if my parents buy all the food?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Tell them that you want them to eat healthier and ask if they can help you by buying more nutritious foods. If they're not helpful, just try to eat the most healthy options available to you, and pay attention to your portion sizes. Look up the MyPlate guide on the Choose My Plate website for further information about what exactly you should be eating.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">

</div>
</div>

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="569001" data-caid="569874" data-cqid="569018" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="2427149" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="0" data-votes_up="0">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Is it good to walk a lot after eating or no?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">A brief walk shortly after eating is a quick way to burn some calories and aid digestion. I wouldn't walk too briskly or for longer than 30 minutes or so right after eating, though.</div>

	<span class="qa_edit_form_inactive_container">

	<div class="clearall"></div>

<!--  Template for rendering a desktop ArticleQuestion -->
<script id="qa_article_question_item" type="text/x-handlebars-template">
			<li class="qa_aq qa_block {{#inactive}}qa_inactive{{/inactive}}" data-aqid="{{id}}" data-cqid="{{curatedQuestion.id}}" data-caid="{{curatedQuestion.curatedAnswer.id}}" data-sqid="{{curatedQuestion.submittedId}}" data-qa_inactive="{{inactive}}" data-votes_up="{{votesUp}}" data-votes_down="{{votesDown}}" data-verifier_id="{{verifierId}}" data-submitter_id="{{submitterUserId}}">
	<div class="qa_divider"></div>

	<div class="qa_li_container">
		<div class="qa_question_tab">{{qa_question_label}}</div>
		<div class="qa_q_txt{{#qa_desktop}} question{{/qa_desktop}}">{{{curatedQuestion.text}}}</div>
		{{#qa_staff}}<div class="qa_staff_info">{{staffInfo}}</div>{{/qa_staff}}

		{{#show_editor_tools}}
		<div class="qa_editor_tools">
			<a class="qa_edit_aq">{{qa_edit}}</a>
		</div>
		{{/show_editor_tools}}

		<div class="qa_answers">
			<div class="{{qa_answerer_class}}">
			{{#qa_desktop}}
				<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box">{{#verifierId}}{{> qa_expert_hover}}{{/verifierId}}</div>
			{{/qa_desktop}}

				<div class="qa_badge"></div>

			{{#verifierId}}
				<a href="{{#formatName}}{{verifierData.name}}{{/formatName}}" class="sp_namelink qa_person_circle" target="_blank" {{#verifierData.imagePath}}style="background-image: url({{verifierData.imagePath}})"{{/verifierData.imagePath}}>
					{{^verifierData.imagePath}}<span>{{verifierData.initials}}</span>{{/verifierData.imagePath}}</a>
			{{/verifierId}}

			{{^verifierId}}
				<div class="qa_person_circle" {{#submitterAvatar}}style="background-image:url({{{submitterAvatar}}})"{{/submitterAvatar}}></div>
			{{/verifierId}}

				<div class="qa_answerer_info">
				{{#verifierId}}
					<div class="qa_user_name">
						<a href="{{#formatName}}{{verifierData.name}}{{/formatName}}" target="_blank">{{verifierData.name}}</a>
					</div>
					<div class="qa_user_title">{{{verifierData.blurb}}}</div>
				{{/verifierId}}

				{{^verifierId}}
					<div class="qa_user_name">{{{submitterDisplayName}}}</div>
				{{/verifierId}}

					<div class="qa_user_label">{{qa_answerer_label}}</div>
					{{#isTopAnswerer}}{{^qa_desktop}}<div class="qa_ta_mobile_extra"></div>{{/qa_desktop}}{{/isTopAnswerer}}
				</div>
			</div>

		{{#qa_desktop}}
			<div class="qa_answer answer">{{{curatedQuestion.curatedAnswer.text}}}</div>
			<div class="qa_answer_footer">
				{{> thumbs_qa_widget}}
				{{^qa_anon}}
				<a class="qa_ignore_answered" href="#">{{qa_flag_duplicate}}</a>
				<p class="qa_ignore_answered_thanks">Thanks!</p>
				{{/qa_anon}}
			</div>
		{{/qa_desktop}}
		{{^qa_desktop}}
		<ul>
			<li class="qa_answer">{{{curatedQuestion.curatedAnswer.text}}}</li>
		</ul>
		{{> thumbs_up_down}}
		{{/qa_desktop}}
		</div>
	</div>
</li>

		</script><!-- Template for rendering an unpatrolled QA --><!--  Template form for desktop thumbs up/down functionality  --><script id="qa_thumbs_qa_widget" type="text/x-handlebars-template">

	</div>
	<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">

		<a href="#" class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box">{{qa_thumbs_help}} <span>{{votesUp}}</span></a>
	</div>
</div>



			</script><!--  Template for rendering a Top Answerers data --><script id="top_answerers_qa_widget" type="text/x-handlebars-template">

<div class='qa_ta_name'>

	{{answersCount}} {{ta_answers_label}}
</div>
<div class="qa_ta_cats">
{{#topCats.0}}
	{{ta_subcats_intro}}
	{{#topCats}}<a href="{{cat_link}}">{{cat}}</a>, {{/topCats}}
	{{ta_subcats_outro}}
{{/topCats.0}}
</div>
			</script>
</div>

    "@context": "http:\/\/schema.org",

    "name": "Eat Healthy and Exercise",

        "url": "https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/29\/Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-17-Version-2.jpg\/aid479768-v4-1200px-Eat-Healthy-and-Exercise-Step-17-Version-2.jpg",
        "width": 1200,
        "height": 900
    },
    "author": {

            "width": 326,
            "height": 60
        },

            "https:\/\/www.youtube.com\/user\/WikiHow"
        ]
    },
    "aggregateRating": {
        "@type": "AggregateRating",
